title: Gateway National Recreation Area: Sandy Hook People
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People     Sandy Hook People                Sandy Hook People           Museum Curator Mary Rasa with Andy Daino, former member of the Civilian Conservation Corps at Sandy Hook. "I just loved Fort Hancock," he remembered. "I enjoyed living here. I think it was the best part of my life." To read Daino's oral history, click on the photo. NPS PHOTO  Generals & kids The Fort Hancock and Sandy Hook Proving Ground National Historic District, which includes the entire peninsula, has many stories to tell. Read the biographies of the people who made their impression on Sandy Hook and Fort Hancock. The Sandy Hook Oral History Program consists of more than 100 interviews with people who either lived or worked at Sandy Hook. Most were soldiers and dependents of the U.S. Army, but many others worked here too. Interviews were conducted by park staff and Monmouth University student interns over several years.  Â      Keeper Trevonian Patterson and his US Life-Saving Service crew. NPS ARCHIVES  Dig deeper Check out these pages for brief biographies of individuals who made their marks on Sandy Hook.
